customer_service.customer.authenticate()[source]

Authenticate a customer.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing ‘username’ and ‘password’

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 401 if unauthorized, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON containing the authentication token

Return type:

flask.Response

Charge an amount to a customer’s balance.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing the amount to charge

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 404 if customer not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the updated customer

Return type:

flask.Response

customer_service.customer.deduct()[source]

Deduct an amount from a customer’s balance.

Customer’s balance must be greater than the amount to deduct.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing the amount to deduct

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 404 if customer not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the updated customer

Return type:

flask.Response

customer_service.customer.delete_customer()[source]

Delete a customer.

Parameters:

request (flask.Request) – HTTP request containing the customer ID

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if customer not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

Success message indicating deletion

Return type:

dict

customer_service.customer.get_all_customers()[source]

Get all customers.

Must be an admin to access this route.

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 401 if unauthorized, 403 if invalid token, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of all customers

Return type:

flask.Response

customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 404 if customer not found, 500 for server errors

customer_service.models module

class customer_service.models.Customer(full_name, username, password, age, address, gender, marital_status)[source]

Bases: Model

The Customer object represents a customer in the system.

Parameters:

  • full_name (str) – The full name of the customer

  • username (str) – The username of the customer (must be unique)

  • password (str) – The plain-text password for the customer (hashed for storage)

  • age (int) – The age of the customer

  • address (str) – The address of the customer

  • gender (Gender) – The gender of the customer

  • marital_status (MaritalStatus) – The marital status of the customer

Variables:

  • user_id (int) – The unique identifier for the customer

  • balance (float) – The current balance of the customer (default is 0)

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password of the customer

class customer_service.models.CustomerSchema(*, only: types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, exclude: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), many: bool = False, context: dict | None = None, load_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), dump_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), partial: bool | types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, unknown: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: Schema

The CustomerSchema object is used for serializing and deserializing customer data.

Variables:

  • gender (Gender) – The gender of the customer serialized using EnumField

  • marital_status (MaritalStatus) – The marital status of the customer serialized using EnumField

  • Meta.fields (tuple) – The fields included in the schema

class customer_service.models.Gender(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

The Gender enumeration represents the gender of a customer.

Variables:

  • MALE (str) – Represents male gender

  • FEMALE (str) – Represents female gender

FEMALE = 'female'
MALE = 'male'
class customer_service.models.MaritalStatus(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

The MaritalStatus enumeration represents the marital status of a customer.

Variables:

  • SINGLE (str) – Indicates the customer is single

  • MARRIED (str) – Indicates the customer is married

  • DIVORCED (str) – Indicates the customer is divorced

  • WIDOWED (str) – Indicates the customer is widowed

DIVORCED = 'divorced'
MARRIED = 'married'
SINGLE = 'single'
WIDOWED = 'widowed'
